glkjni
Interface Glk

public interface Glk

General Glk API methods.

See the glkjni package for general implementation notes.

Method Detail

gestalt

int gestalt(int sel,
            long val,
            int[] arr)
Forwarded from glk_gestalt_ext.

Returns information about support for a certain capability.

Parameters:
sel - The capability that you are requesting information about. It may be one of the constants in GlkGestalt.

val - More specific information about the requested capability.

arr - If non-null, it can be used to return additional information.

Returns:
The status of the requested capability.

namedFile

java.io.File namedFile(java.lang.String filename,
                       int usage)
Forwarded from glk_fileref_create_by_name.

Returns a File representing the name that should be used, or null to indicate failure.

Parameters:
filename - The name requested by the program.

usage - The purpose of the file; it can be interpreted using the methods in GlkFileUsage.

Returns:
A File object representing the name to be used, or null to indicate failure.

promptFile

java.io.File promptFile(int usage,
                        int fmode)
Forwarded from glk_fileref_create_by_prompt.

Requests a filename from the user.

Parameters:
usage - The purpose of the file; it can be interpreted using the methods in GlkFileUsage.

fmode - One of the constants in GlkFileMode.

Returns:
A File representing the name entered by the user, or null to indicate failure.

windowOpen

void windowOpen(GlkWindow splitwin,
                int method,
                int size,
                int wintype,
                int id,
                GlkWindow[] wins)
Forwarded from glk_window_open.

Creates a new Glk window.

Parameters:
splitwin - The GlkWindow object for the window that is being split, or null.

method - The requested direction and division for the split; it can be interpreted using the methods in GlkWinMethod.

size - The requested size for the new window. Its meaning depends on the values of method and wintype:
  • For GlkWinMethod.Proportional, the size is a percentage
  • For GlkWinMethod.Fixed, the size is a value in the measurement system of the split window (lines of text for text windows, pixels for graphics windows). It may be greater than the split window's actual size.
In any case, size will never be negative.

wintype - The type of the window. It will be one of the constants GlkWinType#TextBuffer, GlkWinType#TextGrid, or GlkWinType#Graphics.

id - Not a rock value, but a unique id generated by GlkJNI for the new window.

wins - Used to return references to newly-created GlkWindows back to GlkJNI. win[0] will refer to the new window, and if necessary win[1] will refer to the newly-created pair window.

windowClose

void windowClose(GlkWindow win)
Forwarded from glk_window_close.

Closes a window.

Parameters:
win - The window to close.

setStyleHint

void setStyleHint(int wintype,
                  int styl,
                  int hint,
                  int val)
Forwarded from glk_stylehint_set.

Requests that a style hint be set for windows of a certain type.

Parameters:
wintype - The type of the window. It will be one of the constants GlkWinType#AllTypes, GlkWinType#TextGrid, or GlkWinType#TextBuffer.

styl - One of the constants in GlkStyle.

hint - One of the constants in GlkStyleHint.

val - A value appropriate for the hint.

clearStyleHint

void clearStyleHint(int wintype,
                    int styl,
                    int hint)
Forwarded from glk_stylehint_clear.

Requests that a style hint be cleared for windows of a certain type.

Parameters:
wintype - The type of the window. It will be one of the constants GlkWinType#AllTypes, GlkWinType#TextGrid, or GlkWinType#TextBuffer.

styl - One of the constants in GlkStyle.

hint - One of the constants in GlkStyleHint.

createChannel

GlkSChannel createChannel()
Forwarded from glk_schannel_create.

Creates a new GlkSChannel.

Returns:
a new GlkSChannel.

destroyChannel

void destroyChannel(GlkSChannel schan)
Forwarded from glk_schannel_destroy.

Destroys a sound channel.

Parameters:
schan - The channel to destroy.

setSoundLoadHint

void setSoundLoadHint(int num,
                      boolean flag)
Forwarded from glk_sound_load_hint.

Requests that a sound be preloaded (if flag is true) or unloaded.

Parameters:
num - The number of the affected sound resource.

flag - True to request preloading; false to request unloading.

getImageInfo

boolean getImageInfo(int num,
                     int[] dim)
Forwarded from glk_image_get_info.

Gets the size of an image.

Parameters:
num - The number of an image resource.

dim - Used to return the size of the image. dim[0] will be set to the width, and dim[1] to the height.

Returns:
True if the image information could be determined, false otherwise.

requestTimer

void requestTimer(long millisecs)
Forwarded from glk_request_timer_events (when called with a non-zero value).

Requests timer events at a certain interval. It may be called several times, with varying values for millisecs, without an intervening call to cancelTimer().

Parameters:
millisecs - The (positive, non-zero) interval between timer events.

cancelTimer

void cancelTimer()
Forwarded from glk_request_timer_events (when called with zero).

Cancel the sending of timer events.

select

void select(int[] event)
Forwarded from glk_select.

Waits until an event is available, and then fills in the event array with the details of the event.

  • event[0] - one of the constants in GlkEventType.
  • event[1] - if non-zero, it should be a window id (the value that was passed to windowOpen(GlkWindow, int, int, int, int, GlkWindow[])).
  • event[2] - an appropriate value for the type of event.
  • event[3] - an appropriate secondary value for the type of event.

Parameters:
event - The details of the event.

poll

void poll(int[] event)
Forwarded from glk_select_poll.

Checks for events of type GlkEventType#Arrange, GlkEventType#Timer, and GlkEventType#SoundNotify. If one is available, event is filled in with the details of the event, as by select(int[]). If not, event[0] is set to GlkEventType.None.

Parameters:
event - The details of the event.

exit

void exit()
Forwarded from glk_exit.

Exits the program.
